Reviews.Title: Kind of epic to set up, but completely worth it when you're done!
Reviews.Author: Katie Luther
Reviews.Content: I received this product through the Vine program, free of charge. We live in a ground floor apartment in the city so we do get concerned about security now and then, especially at night. Because we live in an apartment and rent rather than owning, we were somewhat more limited in how and where we could install the cameras. For instance, I would have loved one by the front door, but it's concrete and would probably unnerve the neighbors whose door is right next to ours. So bear that in mind--if you own your home, you will be able to make even better use of this system than I could.Three of the cameras are in various points outdoors, and the fourth one I decided to use as a video baby monitor in the nursery. Physical installation of the hardware was a piece of cake once we figured out the best spots in the wall to drill and hide the cables. So that part of the set-up is no problem--anyone with even modest home maintenance improvement and a basic toolbox could do it.Setting up the feed to the TV was also very simple and worked right away once it was all plugged in. What proved to be a little more complicated was getting the feeds to allow online viewing on the computer, and on the iPhone app. The app is free, but the installation instructions are opaque and required a lot of trial and error on our part before we FINALLY got it to work. Eventually it was all going, but the instructions gave us the wrong IP and port numbers and we just had to be persistent in figuring out what it should have said, as there is little to no customer support for this feature. Important thing is though, it did work eventually.The night vision on this system is fantastic. Late at night, I can see people in dark clothing on the night vision as clear as day--people who, much to my alarm, I *could not see at all* just looking out the window. The motion sensor is very sensitive and has to be turned down quite a bit before it stops triggering when a moth flies by, for instance. Indoors, in the nursery, at first the night vision didn't "click on," but when it did it also showed everything as bright as if all the lights were on (no color).Overall I would highly recommend this system for a small to medium space that needs monitoring. I think it would be perfect for a small business or office, or for a small to medium home (you'd probably want one with more cameras if your home is more than about 1200 sq ft). I wish I had better advice on getting the iPhone and computer feeds to work, but it really was just guesswork and trial and error. The company really should provide better support for this feature, and that's why I've subtracted one star from my review.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: The cameras work great, good day vision, but still hard to see tag numbers on cars and physical features of poeple. You can not see very good at night, more like 40 foot night vision distance. The whole system takes some time to understand how to review and setup the cameras. Not that bad of a system for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product to monitor my home remotely and hoped that it would also send an alarm to me if there was activity. I read, prior to purchasing, all the reviews and saw none of the systems for sale were without some poor reviews. I hoped this one would be the least “rotten of the apples” . After using it I would notbuy it again nor would I recommend it. I’d say “look elsewhere” but I don’t know where else to look. My reasons (long) follow. Installation: Relatively easy though the instructions are not entirely clear in spots. I could not get the free Iphone app Asee to work but Asee+ did. To get your router to work with the system is not simple and I think many would find it troublesome. Remote viewing and control from my laptop was fine. .Also, as another reviewer mentioned, the cameras can’t be ceiling mounted.Alarms: The motion detection feature is the worst feature. In fact, the algorithms for it are so poor that it is useless. Other reviewers have mentioned it and I will expand some on it. I have four cameras set up and I get about 20 false alarms per day. Sunrise, sunset, clouds, shadows, lightning, blinds moving with heat/AC, spiders, moths, squirrels, birds, leaves/branches moving in the wind, etc will trip the sensors. Essentially ANYTHING that changes even on the lowest setting. I have tried moving the cameras, limiting the detection field, and adjusting shades without success. IMO it is not usable as an alarm.Software DVD features: The software works but poorly. Playback for the alarms is confusing and cumbersome. You can get emails for the alarms and if you use the email to text feature offered by the major cell companies, a text on your phone (less the picture). The field for the email is limited to 32 characters which would have been easy to expand so as to allow for multiple emails. As noted about the cameras cannot be ceiling mounted though if one found a way mechanically, the software won’t allow image rotation. You’re always viewing the image upside down or sideways. Also and easy software enhancement which hasn’t been done and leads to the conclusion that this product is not being maintained or enhanced.I could only get an email to gmail to work, my normal ISP would not, which I suspect is because my ISP uses Secure Password Protection and the software does not support it.Customer service: One camera arrived with a minor defect. It took two weeks to get a RMA and UPS shipping label via multiple emails. I could not reach a person by phone. Based on my experience and several other reviewers consider this purchase as “all sales are final” and “as is”.

Reviews.Title: Money better spent else-where
Reviews.Author: Leon C
Reviews.Content: First off, the quality of the video-feed leaves a lot to be desired.If you're looking to just catch someone in the act, these cameras are great.If you're hoping to ID them by capturing their face or their license plate you're out of luck.You would be better off recording with a cucumber.Not only is the video feed poor quality, the actual construction of the camera leaves a lot to be desired.The bolt you need to tighten to keep the cameras from swaying up and down does not completlye go through and thread.It threads in a few centimeters, and pushes against the cable - That's their means of tightening the camera from moving up and down.If you over tighten that bolt it will literally strip the metal and make the camera useless.How can the provided bolt strip the threading so easily? The metal used for these cameras is one notch above aluminum foil.Looking to get the poorly manufactured cameras replaced in a timely fashion?Try again, Defender takes from 2-4 weeks.That aside, if you want to record in higher quality - you need to turn down the frame rate.Basically turning the recording into an old fashion slide show.If you're not a Rocket Surgeon ... good luck setting up the cameras to be view able over the internet.Amazon on the other hand is quick to resolve any issues, and should be commended.The manufacturer on the other hand should be shunned and avoided like rectal cancer.

Reviews.Title: better and easier to setup than expected
Reviews.Author: Angelo Prestigiacomo
Reviews.Content: The Defender 21027 4 pack system replaces my Night OWL system which had problems with the Seagate drive that it came with. I even replaced the drive and had the same issue. I decided to buy the Defender System because it had good reviews and the web site, defender-usa, seemed to have the consumer in mind by the way it provides information on its products, including helpful videos.I did not want to run new cables to hook up to my three existing cameras, but I found that the 12027 pig-tail 12v power connectors were male and so are the connectors on my existing cable. I had to buy female to female adapters to connect to my existing cable and I was able to save the cables that came with the 21027. If you use the cables that come with the 21027, you will not have this issue. I bought a 20" monitor to view the cameras in my living room and then configured port forwarding on my Linksys router for client port 9000 and mobile port 18004. For a linksys router, you go to applications and Gaming and enter ports 9000, 18004 and the IP address of the DVR.With that, I can view and configure the cameras on my PC and on my Android phone and IPAD.I downloaded the ASEE app for both Android and IPAD and I was surprised to see how effortless this app is to setup.Once you have your computer's public IP addess, all you need to enter are the port numbers, the user name and password.The default user name and password work fine, but they should be changed. I did not bother registering for Dynamic DNS because my public IP address has not changed in years; even if it does, I just have to enter the new one in the ASEE app.If I want to see and control the system from my home PC, I just enter the IP address of the 21027 system 192.168.x.x as allocated by the router's DHCP or static address.Most features such as recording and playback can be controlled from the PC as well as from the system menu on the DVR with an excellent remote control or mouse. The DVR has three convenient ways to attach to an exteral device: RCA, VGA or BNC.I am very pleased with the features and functionality of this system and I am giving it a five star rating because of its reasonable price and remote access features.  The camera quality was good for this type of system with 600TVL.

Reviews.Title: So far, I am truly impressed with this system!!
Reviews.Author: Jeffery
Reviews.Content: Arrived packaged very well.  I was trying to get a monitoring system in-place before I left for vacation so my son could monitor my home, so I unpacked the system and had it setup and running in a couple hours. That being said I had downloaded the manual from the website and had already read it cover-to-cover before my system arrived.I temporarily mounted the cameras on some spare pieces of 2"X12" boards, plugged everything into the DVR and turned it on. It took me another hour or so to re-read the portions of the manual and setup everything; time, date, network, camera recording options, etc. using the supplied remote control.I am not a networking professional by any means but I do alright. I could see this portion being the most difficult part for some people, especially if it's your intent to monitor your system from your iPhone. The directions are decent in this area but with so many different kinds of routers on the market, each with interface differences it was a little stressful. Once I discovered that the DVR and my router both support universal plug-and-play (uPnP), I was good to go. I don't know if all these systems support plug-and-play but that is a major plus for this system in my opinion.I downloaded the free app for my iPhone and I can now monitor my cameras/home from anywhere.Night vision is pretty decent.  My farthest distance is about 40 feet.  I can make out everything in the room fairly clearly and I could definitely tell if something was out of place or someone was in there.  The motion detection portion of the system works very well but since mine are all inside and I don't have any pets or things that move, I haven't seen any false alarms yet.The cameras automatically switch between IR and color, depending on amount of light in the room.  When in full color, they are extremely clear and it looks like I'm watching TV.  They make a loud "click" when they switch back and forth so don't be alarmed.Once I returned from vacation, I disconnected everything and ran all the cabling through the ceiling/attic space and permanently mounted the camers to the wall.  That went as well as it could have with crawling around in the attic. I ordered some 1" white cabling grommets from Amazon to feed the wires through my ceiling and the installation looks very professionally done.  My wife just said WOW!The only drawback to these cameras - they have to be wall mounted. The mounts are not oriented to be able to ceiling mount them unless I misread the directions.  Be careful mounting these too close to the ceiling.  I only say that because I had an eirie glow the first night on two of the cameras when they were in IR mode. I figured out that is was reflection coming from my white ceiling, I angled the cameras down just a little more and they are now great.I drilled an access hole in the top of one of my cabinets for the cabling and placed the DVR inside with a small 350 VA battery backup/UPS to protect the system and cameras from power issues, at only $42 I believe that to be a good investment. I can lock that cabinet so the DVR is less accessable.I didn't have to call Customer support for anything yet so I can't speak to that.  This is also the only DVR/camera system I have ever purchased/installed so I don't have anything to compare it to but it was fairly easy to install and works like a champ.  I would highly recommend this system based on my experience.Hope that was helpful!

Reviews.Title: Average
Reviews.Author: TriniMark "Mark"
Reviews.Content: It works, but facial recognition and license plate details are unsatisfactory in broad daylight. Some thieves came into my open yard and stole 2 aircondition units we had brought in to repair. I played back the footage from the camera the car backed up closest to, which was about 20 feet and I could' not get the license plate details. What's even more disappointing is that there is an option to "adjust" the recording resolution on the DVR between D1, HD1 and CIF but evrytime I select the higher resolutions (D1 or HD1) it just resets itself to CIF.

Reviews.Title: Easy to learn software, simple set up and night-vision really works
Reviews.Author: Angela Streiff
Reviews.Content: The Defender 21051 Sentinel is a serious system, with 16 cameras to cover every possible angle you could want to have recorded. For a small home, a 4 or 6 camera system would provide more than enough viewing coverage. The 16 camera system probably best for businesses who want to be able to record footage from inside and outside at the same time, since there's just so many cameras. Each camera provide a wide, easy to see, viewing angle. So 16 cameras will cover a ton of area.While the system may appear overwhelming when you receive it, it's actually easy enough for someone to install themselves. No real need for professional installation, unless you want to save yourself the time, or are less than comfortable with working on a ladder with a drill. By far, the most complicated part is mounting the cameras and running the wires. Not because the cameras are difficult, but because to get the best views it requires mounting them up high. So you're likely going to be standing on a ladder with a drill in hand and working on cable management (finding a way to run the cable from the DVR to the camera along walls or tucked inside things so they're not just hanging).The tools/parts we used were:LadderDrillMounting hardware included with the system (screws, allen wrench/hex key and such)The Defender 21051 Security SystemAn LCD monitor (not included in the system) with a VGA cableAnd external hard drive for downloading footage from the DVR to upload onto my PC for DVD burningPower stripWe started by mounting cameras to the underside of the roof of our garage. This worked well for getting angles of the house, driveway, backyard, entrances, etc. We then mounted cameras to the roof the the house to get views of the garage, front and back yard, property lines and also views of the street in front of our home. It works well if you first decide where you're going to mount the cameras and look into how you will run the wires, before you start putting them up. We tucked most of our outside wires into the siding. When deciding how to run them, it helps to look at cable already installed for other things. We located our TV cable lines that ran along side the house that were tucked into the bottom of our siding. This gave us the idea to do the same with the cameras cable.Each camera has one cable that comes from it. This cable has both the video and the power together in it. At each end of the cable, it splits into two connections. One wall power adapter will supply enough power for 4 cameras. The power adapter is at the same end of the cable as the DVR, so you don't need to worry about trying to run a power supply up walls or onto the roof. Using a power strip located where ever you set up the DVR at will provide all the power you need for all the adapters. Take care to run the cables the correct way. There are little white tags on the end of the cables labeling them as to which end goes to the camera and which end goes to the DVR. We ran the first cable the wrong way, and didn't notice it until we had already threaded the line and tucked it into the siding. So we had to take it all out and swap it out the other way. It's a small, simple mistake. But can cost you a lot of time that checking the tags first would have saved save you. The camera cables very easily lock into place in the back of the DVR. Rather than twisting in, or just being pressed in, there is a locking twist method used to secure them. This makes the cables very secure, yet easy to unhook as well.Included with the cables, DVR and cameras is also a USB mouse and a remote control. The mouse plugs into one of the two USB ports in the back and the remote comes with batteries for wireless control of the menus. As soon as the DVR is powered up and the camera cables are plugged into it, the software recognizes the video feed and displays it. You can set the screen to display the live video of all 16 cameras at the same time, or change it to just show certain ones. There is an abundance of video settings you can customize, such as motion alerts where you can even select specific areas of the screen to adjust the motion sensitivity. You can set the DVR recording settings several ways, and decide what you want recorded and when. We have ours set to record from all the cameras all the time. You can also adjust how the DVR handles the 500GB memory getting full. It can stop recording until you make more room, or just loop around to record over the oldest saved footage in it's memory.I set up my system to be viewed from a LCD computer monitor. There is a VGA output port on the back of the DVR, and I ran a cable from that to the monitor. There is an included video RCA cable which you can use to plug the DVR into a television to use it as video screen as well. The video from the cameras is extremely good. They are in full color in daytime, and transition into night vision in the dark (which is more of a gray scale). For the night vision, the less light there is the better. I am absolutely amazed at how far away you can see with both the daytime footage and the night vision.Just days after installing this system, there was an incident that happened to be recorded by my cameras. A man who lives across the street from us called the police, reporting that his neighbor's dog had attacked him. His neighbor who has the dog claimed his pet was on a chain the the yard, and could not have done anything. We pulled up the night-vision video footage we had of our driveway (which also captures the driveway and house of the man who lives across the street, who made the complaint). We were shocked at what we saw, when it turned out that the man making the complaint had actually gone well into his neighbors yard and thrown an object at his neighbors family dog, then took off running from it when it started barking at him. The officer who responded to the complaint came to our home and viewed the video, then asked if I could burn him a DVD of the footage. So shortly after setting all this up, I found I also needed to learn how to retrieve the video footage for viewing elsewhere, not on the DVR.I used an external hard drive (however for small files, most flash drives will work as well) to copy the "event file" from the DVR to the drive. This is where having the time set properly on the system becomes important. When you need to retrieve footage, you search using date and time filters. If the time is set wrong, you will spend a lot of time looking for the "event" you need. Events, as the system categorizes them, are in one hour segments. So even though I only really need to provide the police with about 5 minutes of video, each of the event files are 1 hour long. The first time I transferred a file, I hooked up my external hard drive via a USB cable to the back of the DVR. There are included instructions as to how to find an event, and how to download a copy of it to an external drive. The second time I copied an event, I tried it using just a USB flash drive, and it worked fine as well.The trick for me then was trying to figure out how to convert the .264 file type that the Defender DVR software saves the events in into a file that can be read by any computer. The Defender software comes with a program for viewing the files using their .264 file type on any computer you want to install it on. However I needed to convert the file to something that the police department would be able to view, without having the Defender software on their computers. After a significant amount of searching, I finally found a very easy solution that works.You simply....Locate the event file on the computer you have it saved on."Right click" on the file with your mouse.Select the bottom option on the list that says "properties"On the tab titled "General", at the top of the box the file name should be there in a text box. Click inside that box and use your keyboard arrows to navigate all the way to the right of the name, where you should see it ending in .264 (that's the file extension name). Simply delete the .264 and replace it with .AVIA warning will pop up explaining that it might alter the file and render it unviewable. Click ok/yes, or what ever other prompt there is to confirm this change. This changes the file type to an easy to view .AVI file type, which just about anyone anywhere can view on their computer. I did this and then burned the file to a DVD.When in comes to camera durability, so far I have been impressed. Strong winds don't wiggle the cameras at all. We had sleet yesterday and the cold freezing rain caused no problems. I've had no problems with any fogging up of the lenses either. I'm living in the very northern area of Minnesota and it's mid December right now. Our temperatures at night are somewhere between 10 degrees and zero. We have over a foot of snow on the ground and the conditions here are generally harsh. So far, nothing has fazed the cameras we have mounted outside, exposed to the elements. The biggest test will be next month in January, when we have days with windchill's easily exceeding -20 degrees (below zero). I have full intentions of updating this review after the cameras have been exposed to that weather, and report as to how well they held up.So in conclusion, the day-time video footage is amazingly clear, the night-vision is everything they say it is and more, and the cameras are well built and designed to stand up to the harshest weather. The software on the DVR for navigating through recorded footage for playback is easy to use and hardware set-up is more labor intensive rather than being difficult. As long as you have no problem using a drill and standing on a ladder, you can easily install this yourself without the need to hire outside help. It's a great system, and has been working perfectly.

Reviews.Title: After 3 Months of Use...
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey Wilford
Reviews.Content: I purchased the system direct from Defender-USA because back then they were running a deep discount. It appears that discount is now available through Amazon. If so that is definitely the way to go.Rather than repeat everything others have said let me emphasize important points that definitely need to be considered.CAMERAS AND PLACEMENT METHODOLOGYI bought the 8 camera and DVR system. The cameras are set up:1) Outside the front door looking almost straight down to cover people at the front door. This camera is set to text me a photo when someone comes to the front door. This works excellent. I've had to trim bushes to keep shadows off of the field of view. Remember that texting a picture is a different address on many people's phones like my Verizon account.2) Inside the house looking at the front door so you can see someone's face as you open the door or if they were to come in uninvited. It's tough viewing during the day because it is so bright outside compared to the image at the front door. Any camera would have an issue with that. At night it is a lot better and works well. This camera is set to turn on and record if camera#1 detects motion. Since I have glass in my front door I can record a face if someone comes up and peers into my door. I have the field of view restricted so people walking by inside the house don't activate the motion detection. This works well.3) Mounted outside on a wall to cover the master bedroom patio, specifically it views the screen door area. It's about 8 feet up and has a good field of view. Drove me crazy when a bird tried to build a nest in the camera housing. Although he was unsuccessful his 1000 trips in vain did cause a lot of unnecessary recording. Camera is set to motion detection with a bush taken out of the motion detection area so the rustling of the leaves don't set off the camera. The ability to mask OUT areas for motion detection is a huge plus of this system.4) Almost identical to #3 but on the main patio. This covers the screen door entrance from this patio. The idea is to cover all the openings where people might try to break in. Be aware that reflections off glass tables will set off the motion so even if there aren't any trees in the field of view if the glass table reflects an image of the trees it will cause detection when they move from wind. So will shadows. I resolved this by masking out the glass tabletop from motion detection. Works well. Again, the ability to mask out areas from motion detection is excellent.5) Inside the house facing the entrance covered by #4. The idea behind cameras 2, 5, and 6  is that cameras looking down don't get good facial recognition, you need to see a face. So looking from the inside out you will see someone at your door/screen door coming in. I masked out areas around it (inside pathway) so people inside the house don't set off the motion detection. If visitors or friends know they are being recorded inside your house be prepared to be lonely and known as weird - the ability of the system to block out areas in the field of view from ever being recorded is a great help to keep your privacy private. The loud click the camera makes when switching from day to night mode (or vice versa) is VERY obnoxious and noticeable. Other reviewers (actually numerous if you read) mentioned cloudy days and this occurring a lot. IT DOES!! The loud click will irritate your significant other and is a huge drawback to the entire system. Switching modes a couple times a minute is not uncommon. Imagine someone clapping their hands in your house a couple times a minute. It forces me to turn on a light in the kitchen to stop it and keep that light on until lighting conditions change. This camera can click every 10 seconds when the conditions are right, unfortunately that means almost every night!6) Inside the house facing the back door that comes from the garage. If someone comes in from that door or the hallway from another screen door I can see their face. This camera is plagued with the same noise issue. I cannot over emphasize the noise and pain of the cameras switching. To make matters worse, when they switch modes it also sets off the motion detection!7) In the garage facing out to cover both garage doors. Works very well. This camera is plagued with the mode switch causing motion detection, even set to the least sensitive setting. During the day the camera will switch modes 15 times, each one setting off the motion detection. As someone else said, even though the camera is technically in a different room, this is in the garage, you can still hear the camera mode switch noise INSIDE the house, it is that noticeable. That is a zero for inside use.8) Outside wall facing the pool and backyard area. This covers anyone messing around in the yard or pool. Works well. Bugs will set it off at night so you have to balance the sensitivity of detecting someone far away versus bugs close by. The advertised 100 feet at night is a huge stretch. Maybe 40 feet as someone else suggested would be far more honest. The camera's color and tint are all controllable and color correction is good as well as the handling of strong light. I have watched the pool company workers work and the inspector's every step during pool construction while I am gone... That is an awesome help.COMMENTS ON THE SYSTEMThe software and DVR is great for normal use. Yes, the manual is difficult to understand and yes you have to experiment. There are lots of adjustments that make the system really helpful. Masking out areas from motion detection, masking out areas from ever recording, emailing photos or texting photos are all great. I have inside and outside cameras that look at the same place working together. yes, its another option - if one camera detects motion you can have it automatically start other cameras. My entire system is set to motion detection because why in the world would you record nothing? There is a setting that allows you to record 10 seconds prior to a motion detection event so there is no reason to constantly record. I have only used maybe a third of my hard drive capacity if that after three months. Folks that think they need to run their recordings continuously will get a lot less - and they are spending a lot of energy recording an empty room. Motion detection is the way to go. HOWEVER, the motion detection working a five star excellent is plagued by the cameras mode switching causing motion detection. This is the second biggest drawback and would make me look at other systems very strongly, or at least the cameras. Because the cameras activate their motion detection when switching it makes the search function of the DVR almost useless. All it takes is for one switch to occur and then it shows an "event" for that time period. Even on the least sensitive setting it still activates the motion detection. If I search a day I might find almost very hour filled with events - but almost every single one is a mode switch. Defender, you need to fix this, your cameras are a one star paired with a four and a half star DVR.NOISE! The noise the cameras make is huge. Please don't excuse this comment but add it to the numerous other folks who mention this problem when cameras are placed inside the house.read the other reviews folks.  This is a huge pain and will stop me from purchasing another system that has these cameras. I will also look to eventually replace the inside cameras with another brand. THIS IS THE BIGGEST DRAWBACK OF THE ENTIRE SYSTEM. Had I paid better attention to other folks comments I would probably NOT purchase this system - or at least these cameras. If I could, I would include a video of the noise it makes, you would then understand the gravity of the issue this causes, and probably rule out this system for inside use.The MAC address of the system is bogus, 11:22:33:44:55 and I believe the reason why my router won't always recognize that the DVR is there. I have not called customer support to talk to them about the networking issues so I will be mute on that subject. Viewing from inside your network works well and is fairly easy to set up. The port forwarding and outside network has yet to work and is problematic. Also read a review or google the open port issue on all DVRs. Almost all of them are made by the same company and all experience the same security issues.Defender's customer support called me 3 weeks after purchase to see how I liked it. That was great! I am not being paid for or compensated for a review like many here are. I opted to purchase an extended warrantee prior to them sending me a note with an offer to extend it if I wrote a review. That cost me the $60 extended warrantee others get free if they write a review here.  I was really busy and away from my house when they called or I would have asked them about the network issues right then as he did offer to transfer me to customer support right then and there... Uncommonly good.I wish I had purchased the 16 camera system. There are many access points or remote areas that are not covered. Think through the placement process PRIOR TO PURCHASING! You can always not use a camera and DVR capacity you have but don't need. You can't add to something that is maxed out. Big mistake on my part. Since the cameras are so noisy I avoided more pain even though most of the other camera locations i want  would be outside.Two cameras were far enough away that I had to use the extension cords that you can purchase separately. However, in an odd twist, the extensions are just that, you can't use the extension by itself but only with the original cord. No use to use one extension to replace a cord and then use two cords together instead of a second extension.I have all of my equipment in a walk in closet, my "safe room" where you can lock yourself in, monitor outside, and call and talk to the law enforcement folks from the safety of a secure room. The folks who installed my burglar alarm system didn't understand why I wanted an alarm panel there until I explained that concept to them, now they are firm believers in all security systems feeding into a safe place.  I would recommend a battery backup for the IP address issues reviewers have mentioned plus it would allow you to see what's going on even if they cut the lock to my meter and pulled the plug on my electricity. Running the cords is not nearly as harrowing as some people suggest. But think through it VERY carefully since it is a huge time commitment.Overall I am okay to fairly happy. That's very happy with the DVR and not very happy at all with the cameras. Other notes are that with this system a subject needs to be within 20 feet of the camera for you to recognize them. The night vision is "okay" but it would be tough to have a good enough quality image to present to the police.  If the cameras didn't make that mode switch noise and they didn't activate the motion detection when switching modes I would be very very happy and give it 4 1/2 stars. If my call to customer support fixes the network issue then it could be a five star.  But NOT with the camera's noise and motion detection/mode switch issue.  Please do not underestimate this issue! Don't consider this system for inside the house use without understanding that it is like someone clapping their hands about 15 feet from you, and it can switch a couple of times PER MINUTE, under the right conditions. If I was married and she was home a lot I really believe the system would have to be shut down or the cameras replaced for her to live with the inconvenience of the noise. In that case it would get a 1 star. The problem is, unless you are willing to pay several thousand dollars for a system it seems like no one is really happy with any brand, just read the hundreds of reviews I have.Ask if you have question. When I get enough time I will tackle the networking issue.

Reviews.Title: A good basic system for the money
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: I ordered this system not expecting the latest greatest technology.  It serves its purpose, mostly as a deterrent and a way to record what goes on around the house.  Installation takes time, you have to figure where to mount cameras, drill holes, fish wires, etc., all part of the normal process.  Setup of the DVR was relatively easy, plugged it in, turned it on and use the mouse to configure.The camera's work well for daylight, but only so so for night vision, but this is pretty common.  The video and pictures are relatively clear within the first 10 to 15 feet.  Beyond that however, you're going to have a hard time clearly identifying someone. I don't see a benefit to "Ultra Resolution" cameras as advertised over the others I have and use.  Again, I wasn't expecting them to be the same as a high dollar true hi-rez camera but I was expecting a tad bit better picture/video.The installation instructions (on the DVD) were average. They could provided a better and clearer understanding of recommended hole size to drill in order to fish the wires, but I figured it out on my own quickly enough.  In one case fishing the wires, they separated from the camera completely rendering the camera completely inoperable.  I will chalk that up to my own installation error, but since it didn't happen to the other 3 camera's, it's more likely the splice at the camera wasn't done properly at the factory.The software on the DVR is very plain, nothing fancy here, but some of the icons are a bit cryptic to figure out.  You'll need to take a few minutes to get used to the graphical user interface and some of the configuration settings. The documentation is included on the enclosed mini-DVD, also available via their website.  I found it easier to use a browser to view and configure the cameras by hitting the Static IP I setup and connecting to my home network.I'm also using the IP Forwarding to view the cameras from offsite, using Android devices (a tablet, and a Samsung SG3) to view them from anywhere around the house, or when I'm on the road.  I installed the free version of IP Cam Viewer, setup the app to find the DVR on a Static IP I was forwarding through the firewall, then had to select Lorex ECR System with Client Port and turned off "Use Experimental h.264 dvr code" in the IP Cam Viewer app. These are settings in the app, not the DVR. So now when I hear a noise or someone rings the doorbell, I reach for my Android Phone to check the camera feeds.  Very nice to have.I had 2 support related issues, and sent 2 emails to their support department (Defender-USA).  One of my issues received a partial reply 36 hours later, the other I was able to resolve on my own.  Customer Service was provided by "Ian", who continually followed up with me over the last few weeks via phone, and via email. While it took some time to get the info I needed to resolve the issue, Ian and Customer Service made things right so I'm happy they kept following up. I'm updating my review and rating as a result of his work, and I would buy from them again without question as a result of the continual support.UPDATE:  Now that I've had the system for quite a while now, I'm still very happy with my purchase and the performance of the system.  Using my Android devices with IP Cam Viewer (see notes above to configure it)along with the IP port forwarding features, I can check the camera's anytime, from anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Cuppy
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this item for our Auto Detail shop. The picture quality is excellent and the DVR menu is easy to use but to access the DVR menu it does need to be connected to a monitor/TV(not a laptop). However once you get it setup the remote viewing can be done from anywhere and is a nice feature. I'm not tech savvy but the Defender Live Chat easily walked me thru any setup issues. Overall I have had no issues and highly recommend the company and product. My only qualm is I would prefer phone support but to find a number is almost impossible and when I did I was on hold for over an hour but the Live Chat is quick and easy. I am just used to phone support.

Reviews.Title: Decent Product, but Limited Capability - One WARNING!
Reviews.Author: Jim M.
Reviews.Content: Update: WARNING - Software saves the video in a raw (or proprietary?) format.  It needs a special program to view it.  Defender has no such program so you have to find one off the Internet that works.  I am surprised by this.  What is the point if you can't do anything with the video?  Anyway...I purchased the Defender 21031 security system to keep an eye on my yard - eight cameras, two on each corner of the house facing down the length of the house so I have overlapping coverage.Packaging: The system was well packed, cables packaged so they were easy to unroll and use, and everything was protected by wrappings.  The manual was not included - something a lot of companies seem to no longer provide.  At 85 pages and in color, it is a bit large for a home printer to print out.  And having a manual in hand is imperative to easy set-up.  In this case, they should have included the manual to ease the use of it during installation and - especially - programming of the cameras and DVR.Construction: The cameras appear to be very sturdy - the body and shield are made of metal, not plastic.  Each set of four cameras hooks up to an a/c plug and the DVR also has it own plug, so three outlets will be needed.  This means each camera will not need an a/c outlet of its own near the camera - outlets need to be close to the DVR unless you want to separate the wires (they are paired - a/c and video for each camera).  Cable connectors are the twist and lock type (not sure what the official name is).  They connect easily and lock into place.  The DVR is designed to accept either a RCA plug for a video monitor or VGA plug for a computer monitor.Installation: Installation is straight forward.  I installed it all very quickly on a table so I could confirm everything operated properly before going through the actual installation.  Because of a leg injury, I had an electrician come out and do the actual mounting of the cameras and running the wires through the attic.  I did the programming.  The cable length is 65 feet per camera - this should be long enough for most homes.  One of the camera cables barely reached the box.  I almost needed an extension cable and it made me wonder if the system would be able to handle an extension cable or if it would drop too much signal.  I don't know the answer to this, but it is something to think about if you need a longer cable run.  The cameras are designed to be mounted on the side of a wall, nut a ceiling or under the eves of a house.Programming: This is where Defender loses a lot of points.  First off, the camera system claims HD.  But with eight cameras, it will not allow HD monitoring - at least not with a respectable frame rate.  The DVR cannot handle it.  One is forced to either use CIF (low quality) or reduce the frame rate.  For HD, I had to reduce the frame rate down to four per second.  I think the system should be built to allow HD at a 30 second frame rate.The input is through a mouse and one must select each keyboard character by using the mouse, which sometimes jumps around, causing one to click on the wrong letter or number.  However, since the interface will probably rarely be used after the initial install, I didn't make this a negative feature.  I do believe it should allow for an optional keyboard to be used in the USB port.  On a positive note, once one camera is set up, there is a feature to copy that information to the other cameras.  After copying the information, one just needs to make the minor changes (like the camera name) to each camera.Usage: The video is okay - not the greatest, but okay.  I am still testing it out, but I am not sure one could identify a person from the video footage with outdoor use.  Night vision was okay, but it cannot penetrate far into a yard.  Security lighting may be required to enable the system to pick up movement or identify anything more than - guessing - about 20 feet from the camera.  The stored video can be set up separate from the real time video, so you can set the resolution to less that the real time, but not greater than.  Some people complained in their reviews that the replay resolution is much worse than the real time feed.  That is probably because they didn't set the saved video at a higher than default resolution - that resolution setting is in a different area of the menu than the live feed video.Audio appears to only be available from Camera 1.  So if you want to hear what is being said at the front door, that would have to be your camera 1.  Back yard, same thing.  Only one place can be rigged for listening.Setting up areas for motion detection is easy enough - select and deselect blocks superimposed over the screen and motion detection is set.  Blocking out areas will prevent tree movement from setting off the recording.  Another nice feature is the privacy setting.  There are two types - one prevents a camera from displaying on a monitor.  That way, no one can see what is being recorded.  Only an Admin can review that footage after the fact.  The other privacy feature is the ability to block out certain areas within the image.  That way, if the camera is pointing at some place where you have to enter a code or password, it won't record it.OVERALL: A decent security system for the money (I got it on sale for a couple hundred dollars off).  It could definitely use some improvements, but it seems to be a notch above most other home systems.  I was trying to decide between three and four stars.  I went with four because the overall quality is better than most.r/Jim

Reviews.Title: poor support time
Reviews.Author: Amsoilman "Amsoilman"
Reviews.Content: First call to support took 40 minutes to talk to someone.  My second call I'm listening to lousy music for over an hour and still waiting to talk to someone.  Yes I'm still on hold.I also had a bad camera and I have to pay for shipping their faulty camera back to them.  I would look elsewhere for a system.

Reviews.Title: GREAT SYSTEM
Reviews.Author: dabronzophllc
Reviews.Content: JUST GOT THE SYSTEM HOOKED UP 3 OF THE 8 CAMERAS VERY VERY SIMPLE , THE HARDEST PART IS RUNNING THE WIRES WHEREVER THEY NEED TO GO. THE CAMERAS WORK EXCELLENT THE CLARITY IS PERFECT THE NIGHT VISION IS SUPERB. SO FAR IM VERY HAPPY WITH THIS AND CANT WAIT TO SEE MY ROTTWEILERS TEARING UP ANY STUPID ROBBERS IF THEY COME IN MY YARD. I ALSO GOT A MATCHING DUMMY CAMERA FROM SOMEWHERE ELSE FOR THE TELEPHONE POLE LOOKS AND IS VERY CONVINCING. OUR OLDER NEIGHBORS HAVE BEEN ROBBED IN OUR QUIET NEIGHBORHOOD DUE TO THESE TIMES WITH OUR ECONOMY ,AND OUR HOME STANDS OUT IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD (VERY NICE), MY FAMILIES SECURITY MEANS MORE TO ME THEN ANYTHING THIS WHY WE PURCHASED THIS SYSTEM . WE WILL RECOMMEND THIS TO OUR NEIGHBORS AS WELL IM SURE THEY WILL BE JUST AS PLEASED.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Mario Aguilar Jr. "Gizmo"
Reviews.Content: How can I start with this review..... I was a little scared compare to other cameras and the prices because this one look a lot cheaper with a lot more extra features.  Ok, I install it without a problem instructions are extremely clear to follow.  I even set up with my internet and I'm able to see my camera from anywhere in the world that I get internet.  It is pretty sick to see that, I travel a lot and any time I want I just can watch my house.  You can also set alarms to of motion detector, that I disable it because it is too sensitive and it triggers the alarm every 5 mins.  I put it to email me when something is detected and actually works you get an email with a picture.  I guess this would be good if was use inside as I have it outside there is wind and leaves and spiders around the camera.  The main reason I got this was because suppose at night has a big range of night vision, and it does!! at night is super clear and you are able to see every in complete darkness!!!  Is it weather proof, ummm I had a huge thunderstorm the other day and it didn't get affected, now just waiting for the winter to see how it handles snow..... over all, I will buy the same brand but now with MORE cameras.

Reviews.Title: 4 Stars for the DEFENDER 4 Channel Security System
Reviews.Author: L. Reeves "A Life Bound By Books"
Reviews.Content: This was our first security system and to us the biggest challenge was figuring out where to put the four cameras and how much cable you'll need in relation to that. We had to rethink it a few times but once you get them positioned and in range of the receiver it was great. My husband is an IT guy and I'll be honest he did all the software set up. He said it was a breeze to install but I'm not so sure. I'm sure I would have been able to figure it out, but it's pretty handy to have an IT guy in the house.The system comes with everything you'll need, including plenty of wire to run line for the size of our house and then some. We've hooked it up to our main television, which you'll need to have a tv or computer to hook the system up to. A huge advantage for having this system and having it hooked up to our tv is that added security of viewing the outside of our house with ease. Speaking of - As for monitoring and the quality I found it to be really good and was very happy to have this installed at our house and the feeling of protection it gives helps you sleep at night. I do highly recommend this system.

Reviews.Title: Best of the low-mid range security systems
Reviews.Author: Surface to Air Missle
Reviews.Content: For the simple do-it-yourself (DIY) home surveillance hobbyist, the Defender 21027 4-Channel Smart Security system represents a very high quality product in the lowest tier of home surveillance systems.  This is a great system to get if you A) are new to the game, B) have a relatively low viewing area to cover, C) are on a tight budget.You may be asking yourself, can I set this thing up?  Well, that depends on how good you are at two things.  Frist, are you somebody that has can drill holes and run wire throughout your house?  Can you bolt the cameras onto the outside of your abode?  If not, then you will probably need a professional to help you with these things so keep in that mind. Second, programming the DVR and setting up viewing and recording options are time sinks, but the learning curve isn't too high and its relatively easy if you know how to augment given instructions with googling and chat forums.  If you are someone that has difficulty programming your DVR to record shows, you aren't going to be able to handle the Defender's installation by yourself.  You also need to have your own access to the network for remote viewing of course.Overall the cameras work pretty well and look they will hold up for a while through some degree of bad weather.

Reviews.Title: cheap product / limited customer service
Reviews.Author: Ero
Reviews.Content: less than one year old and now returning for the second time for repair. The only way to contact customer service is to email and wait for them to respond. Do not buy. Cheap China electronic hardware and the software is not very impressive also.

Reviews.Title: Stable and dependable.
Reviews.Author: Nicholas P. Sugleris
Reviews.Content: I've been more than impressed so far with the performance of the device and Defender is good with their support when every other kit like this just seems to have crap support or its got great support and its a dinky kit.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Yamikka Reed
Reviews.Content: I ordered these over a year ago and they are still working great.  The night vision is good, but of course it's not in color and you can't really make out the exact "object," but still works good.  Great product, especially for the price!  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Clear picture!
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: We set this system up in a couple of hours, very clear morning and night and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great buy and great system
Reviews.Author: dee
Reviews.Content: System was relatively easy to install and the price is great!  Clarity of picture - day and night - is awesome!  Sense of security, after installing driveway sensors to notify of any approach, is unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: The system was easy to install. The DVR had to be reformatted to allow for back up storage but we caught a thief on the property a few weeks after the installation so it paid for itself.

Reviews.Title: Ok Bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Mark Pineda
Reviews.Content: This is an OK security camera system for your manye, and ok value. But I did not like the quality of the cameras. I installed one camera above my garage door which is about 30-40 feet from the sidewalk, you could probably make out family and strangers if you saw them again but anything farther is just a blur. License plates? Forget it, this is not the security system if you want to see license plates, it can hardly see the license plate of my car in the drive way and worse is, at night all you see is a very bright reflection of where the license plate is.

Reviews.Title: No problems.
Reviews.Author: Edwin Kubojiri
Reviews.Content: This is my first security camera setup for my home, and I like it. Hook up was easy enough. The programming of the system could be improved, but nothing that can't be worked out with a little fiddling.

Reviews.Title: Will work on HDTV using HDMI
Reviews.Author: Visa "Heneryg"
Reviews.Content: I have just purchased the DEFENDER 21030 pending its use on displaying the DVR on my HDTV screen. Yes you can display live observation using the HDMI connection. this works with all DVR's that have HDMI port, VGA and coax input. I enclosed the diagram I found at  [...]

Reviews.Title: works well.
Reviews.Author: M. W
Reviews.Content: I hooked up three out of the four cameras and they seem to work well. the claim of being able to see things a hundred feet or more is inaccurate. sure you can see objects at that distance but you're not going to be able to make out who or what they are. realistically 30 feet or so is about the right amount of distance to view a person's face with these cameras.I chose to use rigid conduit to run the wires along the side of my house rather than drilling holes in the brick. It took more time to do it that way but it works well for me and cost about an extra $120.the DVR seems to work well however it doesn't always save certain settings and I find myself having to restart the DVR every now and then. if you put your settings up to the highest, which I did of course, you will find that two years worth of recording data is not realistic. I figure I should be able to get at least two weeks worth of data recorded before it starts to overwrite.setting it up for viewing over the internet isn't too hard. You just have to make sure that you open the correct ports on your modem.I tried using a few of the available apps for my cell phone and tablet and I found the original Asee app works best. the other two apps that were made by the same company didn't save the port or IP information after exiting the program.overall I would say this is a good product for the price and if you're looking for something to help watch over your home or personal belongings while you're not there this is a good start

Reviews.Title: Defender dvr
Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: Works well  Good price.Can't get it to work with windows 7 or 8iPhone App good.  Had a lot of trouble connecting it automatically to DyndnsSorted after a chat to support

Reviews.Title: 21030 Sentinal kit
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Kit was complete including all hardware. Simple instructions.. Hardest part of installation was climbing through the attic to run wires.

Reviews.Title: great buy with no issue after several months use
Reviews.Author: Jomyron
Reviews.Content: Pro:resolution (not hd, but not far from it within 40 feet) I can recognize a friend of mine from about 30-40 feet relatively easy.Only took me 30 minutes to have a basic setup.  Took about an hour or 2 to get the network inside my place and the remote connection through my android device working properly even over 3g/4g/4glte.  Other reviews go over more detail of you'd like to know more about that.The box was neat and contained all the screws I needed.Cons: the term ultra resolution may cause some people to think it's 4k like the tv's that refer to their resolution as ultra hd. I think the actual resolution is 600 tvl. Which is pretty decent considering the store and bank cameras u see are often only 480 tvl, with only the major banks having cams at 700tvl or hd.

Reviews.Title: home defense
Reviews.Author: Krystal
Reviews.Content: My friends thought it nuts, but after some unwelcome visitors I got to defending my home well. I installed them all in under 3 hours. Very easy to do.

Reviews.Title: Still love it after a year.
Reviews.Author: DJ Luke Duke
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera system upon moving my business into a new storefront.  I didn't have a huge budget, but definitely didn't want to be stuck with a "toy" grade surveillance system.  After much reading, I settled on the Defender Sentinel 21027, and have been very pleased with my decision.Mounting the cameras was very simple, as was hooking up the unit.  The DVR practically works without any setup, and is recording video almost as soon as you plug it in.  The video is much clearer than perhaps any other surveillance video that I have ever seen.  One of my customers saw the video once, and even commented in amazement on the quality.Remote viewing took a bit of effort to setup, but that is mostly due to IP address and browser settings.  Just a tip: if you don't have a static IP address from your ISP, try using a dynamic DNS service like "no-ip.org".  I'm not going to write a tutorial, but that should get you pointed in the right direction.  Also, once you "almost" get it connected, you might have problems with your browser not wanting to download the unsigned Active X control.  This is simply a matter of changing your browser security settings, installing the control, and then setting them back again.  Boom... there I am looking at my shop in Pittsburgh from my laptop in Las Vegas.  Sweet!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with product and amazon
Reviews.Author: Sevag D "Sev"
Reviews.Content: I received the package today, it arrived super fast! However I will have to actually rate the product when I receive it since I was sent the wrong one! They send me the model 21013 instead of 21030. It is just so unfortunate seeing as this is one of the more expensive items I have purchased on Amazon and I bought it as one of the holiday daily deals! Good thing this is for my personal home and not an actual christmas gift for someone or I would be incredibly annoyed. I am shipping back the package tomorrow for a replacement. Hopefully it won't be a difficult process to get the right model and I can write a more accurate product review.10/31/2013 Update:So this definitely deserves an update that I have been too busy during the holidays to get to. Right after I wrote the above review Amazon emailed me within a half hour apologizing for the mistake (which really isn't their fault it is the manufacturer who packaged and labeled the box incorrectly). They shipped me the correct item OVERNIGHT free of charge which arrived the next day and is the exact item I purchased! they sent the item even before I had the chance to ship back the incorrect item. This is one of the best customer support experiences I have EVER had with any purchase anywhere! They were very prompt in responding, corrected the error as fast as was humanly possible, and set it up so I could ship back the items at their cost at my leisure. I will never hesitate to purchase anything from Amazon if this is really the kind of support that I will have access to on the off chance something goes wrong. But so far this has been the first.As for the camera I have not yet mounted them but have run them around my home as a trial basis figuring out how best to play them outside. The DVR is incredibly simple and easy to operate. The camera are of good quality materials and the video image is clear enough for security purposes. Night vision can be a bit blurred at a distance which is to be expected but right up to say the front door and it is easy to tell who it is. I will be mounting an IR spotlight for the main camera to the front of the house just to better expand the night vision capability. The package came with everything I need and for my home the included cables are long enough for the run I am planning. The only downside I can see and where others have mentioned is the very audible click sound it makes when switching night vision on or off. Now this isn't a concern at all as they will only click twice a day while outside and you will most likely be no where near it when it happens however if you plan to mount these indoors for some reason especially in a room where you may be turning the lights on and off often this can become very annoying very fast.I am very happy with the cameras, and even happier with Amazons customer support and lightening shipping!

Reviews.Title: Good system / You will need help porting it
Reviews.Author: JRO
Reviews.Content: I have had this system for approximately 9 months and like it.  It was pretty easy to install without any tech knowledge.  However, I feel the menu is a little more complicated than it could be, especially when it comes to playing back the video.  Porting it to a mobile phone or computer is virtually impossible to do on your own and I almost rated it a 1 for that very reason.  However, I was pleasantly surprised when  the I received a call from tech support to assist me.  They stayed on the phone for an hour walking my wife and I through the process until it worked.  I am very grateful that they had the patience to walk us through this process.  One thing you should know before you try to call tech support is you have to fill out a request and it says it could be 2-3 days before someone contacts you.  However, I received a call hours later.

Reviews.Title: Very good quality !
Reviews.Author: greg weaver
Reviews.Content: This camera set does the job it was intended to. Very good day and night viewing. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Provides good security, but I had a number of camera warranty repairs.
Reviews.Author: jbfkb
Reviews.Content: Have had this system in place for 11 months now and it's doing good. Menu system is a little crude, but not too bad after you get used to how it's setup. I spent a lot of time figuring out how to configure the remote viewing by smartphone. The company has since posted an automated app that probably makes it a lot easier now.It came with everything needed to setup security from several angles. I ordered one extra extension cable to reach the far end of the house.I have had four warranty repairs on the cameras over those 11 months. First I had one that stopped illuminating the area during darkness. They sent me an RMA and It took about a month to get it replaced. Then I had another one stop working in the night mode, again. Another month to get it replaced. Then one stopped working all together about the same time another one stopped working in the night mode, again. Another month, this time I was down for two cameras at once. But, the company did honor their warranty and it's been working okay for a couple of months now. Hoping I have those problems behind me.

Reviews.Title: Great value system.
Reviews.Author: Michael Boone
Reviews.Content: I like this system quite a bit more than the ZModo system that my mother purchased.  The camera resolution isn't good enough to make out things like license plate numbers (I suspect none of these type of cameras are, that you would have to go with an IP camera system and spend a lot more money).  But I have this set up for remote viewing and can check on the house from my phone no problem.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: Mikec6463
Reviews.Content: So  far it's  been  great.  my  last system  was good for about 2  years  before the hard drive went. since I  already had 4 cameras I  bought this system  allowing me to upgrade to 8.

Reviews.Title: Great System And Keeps My X Wife Away
Reviews.Author: PrettyPicky
Reviews.Content: This is a great system and especially for the price. I have it set to record 24/7 and the night vision is very good so I can watch things live as it records if I choose.I'm getting about 35 ft of recognizable night vision which is required for court. I can see about 65 ft but it gets iffy but I love this system and it is perfect for what I need.

Reviews.Title: Decent, barebones security system
Reviews.Author: Jack Hink
Reviews.Content: Not so Hi-res: I don't know if I mounted them too high, but the cameras' output isn't particularly crisp. Reading a license plate would be possible if the car were parked close, but not past 15' or so, and not at night.Not Mac-ish: Guess I'm spoiled by Apple products, but the user interface isn't particularly well organized or intuitive. Especially confusing is the prominent placement given the controls for a PTZ camera, which isn't even included. But including both a remote and a mouse was helpful, I suppose. Better would be making it so you could accomplish ALL settings with either (or both!).Sending the camera output to our computers and mobile phones was easy. Huge lag waiting for the images to come up often, though, especially on the phone.Ease of Startup: System was pretty easy to assemble and get working. But wading into the various menus to make settings is a real slog. As I said, not well organized. Too many clicks to get the smallest thing changed... If you're gonna make the same software serve for a bunch of different products or setups, it oughta be really well thought out. Insanely great, this ain't.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money
Reviews.Author: darrin sirois
Reviews.Content: The price was right and the installation wasn't too bad.  The software is not top notch but it does suit the purpose.  Getting it on the internet will require some tech savy knowledge but if your IT smart it's easy.  I wish that bringing up recorded video was easier, navigating through the menu is not intuitive.  You can get through it but it does take a few minutes to figure out what your looking at and searching for old video.

Reviews.Title: lots of effort, not much satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Neo, the renaissance man "s/w designer in a h...
Reviews.Content: technically, I guess this system was OK a couple of years ago.  the installation does require a lot of work, not a problem, I was up for that.  but, the supplied installation kit is for a pretty small house, even smaller than the one this was bought for, so extra cable would be needed for my desired setup.  the user interface is OK, but very dated and if you don't know exactly what is required, you'll need to contact tech support - who are actually the shining stars for this product.  but the rating isn't for them - they'd get 5 stars.the resolution of the cameras is not at all what I expected from reading the description in ad and on the box.  maybe it too is just dated.  the frame rate and resolution were very disappointing.  the big factor for returning though, was the need for so many different customizations in the setup.  it was reminiscent of setting up communications for a home network back in the 1980's. too much manual intervention required.the price was lower than most places, so I thought I was getting a pretty good bargain.  not true.  maybe I just had too high hopes?

Reviews.Title: Good security system but be ready for a rough install
Reviews.Author: Archimedes
Reviews.Content: Now that my security system is installed I really love it. The cameras function properly and there is plenty of memory. They cover the entire perimeter of my house and have good quality footage. However, for me the big part of this product was the install. Once we recieved it me and my husband looked over the directions and found it was going to be too much for us to handle for self-install as far as running the wiring and putting the cameras up. We saw that there was an install line you could call to have someone come out so we opted to call. The price quoted was about as much as the system sells for. This was pretty outrageous. Luckily after a few months of asking around we found a local handyman that could do it for us. If you buy this system be advised that you will likely have to get someone to install it or be prepared to spend ALOT of time doing it yourself.

Reviews.Title: Good only to see what happening.
Reviews.Author: CARLOS R. PENA EVERTSZ
Reviews.Content: I bought this surveillance system for my home. The image quality isn't enough for licenses plates unless the car is near to the camera only if the thief wants to be captured. In countries like mine, Dominican Republic, where the thief knows a lot of these kind of equipment, they just stay 4 or 5 meters away from the camera to successfully avoid identification.. I tried to find something high definition but in the surveillance world 600-700 lines video is considered High Definition. 600-700 isn't enough i hope to see 1080p or better resolution products soon. Other backward is the fact that the video stored have quiet lower quality than the live view.Finally, I am setting up an Linux server to take high resolution pictures, 8mpixels each. I hope my system takes several times better quality pictures than this surveillance system for less money.

Reviews.Title: Very Good System
Reviews.Author: steve szabo
Reviews.Content: I love the Cameras, they are very clear day or night. The Dvr is nice to and it didn't take no time to setup the software on the computers. I still have a few things learn but it all seems pretty easy.

Reviews.Title: great for the money
Reviews.Author: robert thompson
Reviews.Content: The cameras have great resolution. I can see my neighbors across the street. The only problem I had was one of the cameras  did not work. The customer service, though, was easy to deal with and the return went fine. The hook up was simple, like hooking up a stereo. The dvr is easy to learn how to use. I have not hooked it to my computer yet, so I dont know how that will go. I only recommend getting the dvr with at least eight camera ports. I thought I only needed four and wish I could add more.[ a lot of blind spots]. The first week I caught someone vandalizing my car at night and I was able to identify them easily. BUSTED. Great system!

Reviews.Title: Good Security Camera System
Reviews.Author: Ajeeb J. Titus "AJ"
Reviews.Content: Good 8 camera Security System.  Supposed to be higher resolution than other systems.  Works okay for me so far.  It's been a month now.  Fairly easy to install and came with everything I needed. Did not need the extra wire.

Reviews.Title: Never received the correct items
Reviews.Author: ZechariahB
Reviews.Content: I was sent 3 of these, but none of them were the right model according to the order.  The outside of the box said 21030, but the DVR was an older model.  Amazon said since I received the first few with the wrong numbers then I was fully refunded but I was never contacted by Defender explaining how this is happening and I still needed a DVR.  So I ended up ordering the Q-See and I hope it will not be a disapointment since I have been doing Security installs for over 15 years.

Reviews.Title: Nocturnal Cat Catcher  It works, but not as well as I would like
Reviews.Author: JRH "j5094"
Reviews.Content: First, other reviewers who wrote long descriptions have it about right.  Second, here are my impressions. The product is easy to use and easy to install, except for the wiring, which is a problem with any wired device. The four cameras give good coverage - three outside and one inside.  There is more than enough space on the storage unit for a good long record. However, the images are not sharp the way a camaera might be - even an older low resolution point and shoot camera.  It's good enough to identify that someone has been at the door, but not neceassarily good enough to always identify the person. Good lighting really helps. The name and description imply "ultra resolution". I guess that sounds better than "adequate resolution" for advertising.  Connections with a PC are easy. Bottom line, is that this is a low cost unit that is giving good value for the money, but it does not provide high quality images. Within its limitations, I would recommend the DEFENDER 21027.After using this for a while, I got some good pictures of neighborhood cats. The DEFENDER showed that they were definitely not dogs. I never knew what actually goes on at night. I guesss my problem is not enough human prowlers. If those cats had been prowlers bent on property damage, I would have the evidence. Of course, my cat detected the cat critters without the need for technology. For her, there was no need of next-day-proof. Bottom line: the DEFENDER 21027 rocks  - at least for critter detection. My cat now recommends the DEFENDER 21027 for humans.

Reviews.Title: Coulda been a contender
Reviews.Author: Tyler Forge "realist"
Reviews.Content: Executive summary: Wait another year, maybe it'll be ready then.This system seemed so close to what I want.  Lots of pretty good cameras.  Internet connectivity.  Hmmm, that's pretty much it.  so...I tried for hours to get my computer to talk to the main unit.  No luck.  My particular mix of windows (windows 7 professional, 64 bit), internet explorer (version 9.08) simply did not want to install that ActiveX component.  If you're paying attention here, you just went "WOAH!!".  Yup, you have to install an activex component to watch the video.  That sure had my security hackles raised.  Firstly, for security reasons I rarely run internet explorer and avoid activex and .net like the plague.  Still I was so hopeful that this security camera system would be awesome that I went ahead.  The directions give two methods of opening up your computer nice and wide to get that activex thing in.  Nope.  Then, I surfed the web and tried a few other things.  Nope.  Finally, I unplugged my cable modem (no need to be too naked), disabled Microsoft security essentials and eset nod32 (am switching from nod32 to mse).  Then, with everything sitting as wide open as I could get it I tried all those things again.  Nope.The really annoying thing about this is wondering why the activex thing.  How 2002.  Non of the video streaming sites (including Amazon's) need to plug an activex component into IE.  In fact, I can watch them with any old browser.  Anyways - I am way way not pleased with the internet capabilities of the defender 21031.  In fact, if it had worked as advertised I would have bought a separate computer to handle the internet connection for it.  There is no way I'd run a machine I depend on with the level of insecurity.  C'mon product designers, plop a simple web server in there.  Webcast the video like everyone else.OK, enough griping.  From the manuals and everything it is obvious that the guys who designed this thing had extremely high aspirations but that a few snafus stole their thunder.  Other than the network port being essentially useless, the rest of the system is fairly nice.  The cameras put out nice color video.  When it gets too dark you the camera kind of clunks and is in different mode that works pretty well in the dark.Anyways....  If you want a system without all the networking goodness, then this is actually a pretty good one.  I do confess to liking it for just that.  I'm glad I kept a few VGA cables around "just in case" because the main unit only has a VGA video out.  Other than that, from a hardware perspective, the system is (almost) up to date and I like messing around with all those menus and modes.  It'll take a major software upgrade to make this system live up to its promise though.

Reviews.Title: Defender 21027 Sentinal 4 channel system
Reviews.Author: Vernon C. Stroble
Reviews.Content: Defender 21027 Sentinel 4-Channel Smart Sentry DVR with cameras and remote control.. Worked very well and Easly installed and setup.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Benjamin F. Anderson
Reviews.Content: A good solid camera system, easy to set up and manage. The camera resolution could be a bit better, but it's not bad, and for the price, is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Good for first time user...
Reviews.Author: Denise B.
Reviews.Content: We were broke into a month ago and wanted to install a camera surveillance system. This was fairly easy to install. Had to call tech service to install on computer but didn't take long once she got me through it. The system itself is very rugged material. The infrared lights up at night to deter burglars. The only thing I don't like about it is the visibility isn't all that good. When you zoom it in to the targeted item, it blurs it out....

Reviews.Author: r1bikergrl
Reviews.Content: Bought this system for the options (motion activated, timed/scheduled, as well as the night vision length).  Night vision is excellent.  Looks like I have my porch light on.  Bad thing, is there are no directions or easy way to set up.  I can not seem to get my router to connect with the system, and tried all their "solutions".  Then it wants me to do this port forwarding where it costs me more money?  I don't think so.  Disappointed that there isn't 24/7 service as when you're checking your systems, sometimes its at night and when you're talking about security and protecting your home or business, waiting til the next day just doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: prefect
Reviews.Author: gopi patel
Reviews.Content: Easy install great picture what a deal works great viewing from my phone cheap super fast delivery you can't beat it ordered more for my other stores

Reviews.Title: After one month even Customer Serviced Impressed me
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rice "justCARRYINGon"
Reviews.Content: OK so I installed the system about a month ago now. Neighbors asked of the costs and ongoing cost, they appeared shocked when they heard no monthly fees associated. But the final straw was I had a camera glitch, it went to Night Time Mode (B&W;) in the middle of a Florida Sunshine filled day. I rebooted but that didn't solve the issue. A few lines in an email to the Manufacturer's email address with the necessary info on the unit, date of purchase, Serial Number. A brief description of the issue I was seeking assistance on and by days end I got a response that gave me several options to try and an alternative if they failed. The second such option fixed the camera as it was stuck in night time mode (although the LEDs appeared to be functioning correctly) by removing the power source to that specific camera briefly then reapplying it.... fixed in a minute. For this and these reasons I would not hesitate to recommend aside from great pictures and easy installation.

Reviews.Title: Defender security system

Reviews.Content: fast delivery, the cameras work great, the only problem I see is navigating the menu otherwise great great deal.I had looked at other systems and ended going for the damaged box deal it was a great great move it saved me money and I cannot complain about the quality of the system.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed

Reviews.Content: This security system has the same features as compared to a Lorex brand. I am disappointed in the quality of the cameras. I made a wrong choice.

Reviews.Title: good system.
